metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31651 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
In SoX 14.4.2, there is an assertion failure in rate_init in rate.c inlibsox.a.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
sox - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1').
